Titus__02.1: But speak thou the things that become sound doctrine:
Titus__02.2: That the aged men be sober, chaste, prudent, sound in faith, in love, in patience.
Titus__02.3: The aged women, in like manner, in holy attire, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teaching well:
Titus__02.4: That they may teach the young women to be wise, to love their husbands, to love their children,
Titus__02.5: To be discreet, chaste, sober, having a care of the house, gentle, obedient to their husbands, that the word of God be not blasphemed.
Titus__02.6: Young men, in like manner, exhort that they be sober.
Titus__02.7: In all things shew thyself an example of good works, in doctrine, in integrity, in gravity,
Titus__02.8: The sound word that can not be blamed: that he, who is on the contrary part, may be afraid, having no evil to say of us.
Titus__02.9: Exhort servants to be obedient to their masters, in all things pleasing, not gainsaying:
Titus__02.10: Not defrauding, but in all things shewing good fidelity, that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour in all things:
Titus__02.11: For the grace of God our Saviour hath appeared to all men;
Titus__02.12: Instructing us, that, denying ungodliness and worldly desires, we should live soberly, and justly, and godly in this world,
Titus__02.13: Looking for the blessed hope and coming of the glory of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ,
Titus__02.14: Who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and might cleanse to himself a people acceptable, a pursuer of good works.
Titus__02.15: These things speak, and exhort and rebuke with all authority. Let no man despise thee.
